title: If an asteroid got too close to the Earth, does the military have a way of changing its trajectory? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, it does not. In fact the use of nuclear weapons is about the worst thing you could do: there’s nowhere near enough nuclear warheads on Earth to be able to reduce an asteroid to its component atoms, the best that’s going to happen is splitting it into a few chunks. You will have turned a single armour piercing bullet into buckshot. Multiple very large impacts rather than one huge one.

Not after it gets too close, but the good news is asteroids orbits are highly predictable, we can usually tell it’s going to get too close 20 years ahead, and then we only need to give it a slight nudge to deflect it.
